Mahmoud Panbetchi, of Teheran, Iran are interested in various types of materials, readymade blouses. Cutlery, such as forks, knives and spoons, electric wires fittings accessories, wall plugs and switches, ceiling roses etc, stationery of all kinds, typewriter ribbons, and carbons, scissors for tailors and household use, knitting kneedles, hand sewing needles, ribbons etc. We are given to understand that no export and import licence is required for these particular commodities. We shall be glad if you would kindly confirm this, and also advise us whether it is possible for you to assist us in obtaining an allocation of textiles for this particular market. We await with interest your reply. lours faithfully, CLARKE & SMITH (INDIA) LTD., CJS/D nt.

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of correspondence between Clarke & Smith (India) Ltd and the External Department, India Office regarding export and import licenses for shipping goods to Persia [Iran].
